item.title: Aeva strikes lidar chip-making deal with LG subsidiary
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: LG Innotek, the components and materials subsidiary of South Korea’s LG Group, has struck a manufacturing partnership with Aeva Technologies, a developer of 4D LiDAR sensing systems.

item.title: AI data analyst startup Julius nabs $10M seed round
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Julius is designed to act like a data scientist by analyzing and visualizing extensive datasets and then performing predictive modeling from natural language prompts.

item.title: Waymo taps Avis to manage robotaxi fleet in Dallas
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Avis will handle general depot operations, including charging and maintaining the vehicles. Users will be able to hail a robotaxi through the Waymo app.

item.title: Harmonic, the Robinhood CEO’s AI math startup, launches an AI chatbot app
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: The chatbot app, which is available in beta on iOS and Android, lets users access its AI model, Aristotle.

item.title: Flexport sells former freight unicorn Convoy’s tech 2 years after buying it
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The assets of Convoy are now in the hands of DAT Freight & Analytics.

item.title: Microsoft Edge is now an AI browser with launch of ‘Copilot Mode’
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Microsoft's Edge browser introduces an AI-powered "Copilot Mode" for smarter web browsing.

item.title: Anthropic unveils new rate limits to curb Claude Code power users
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: The new rate limits will go into effect August 28 for subscribers to Anthropic's $20-per-month Pro plan, as well as its $100- and $200-per-month Max plans.

item.title: Trump’s cybersecurity cuts putting nation at risk, warns New York cyber chief
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The top cybersecurity official in New York told TechCrunch in an interview that Trump's budget cuts are going to put the government at risk from cyberattacks, and will put more pressure on states to secure themselves.

item.title: Amazon disputes report that it raised prices of popular items since Trump took office
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Amazon published a lengthy rebuttal to a WSJ report that found that Amazon prices had increased since Trump announced tariff plans.

item.title: Why Dispo’s co-founder made the leap from social media to steelmaking
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Daniel Liss, co-founder of the social network Dispo and the dating app Teaser AI, is convinced he’s onto the next big thing: steelmaking. It all started a few op-eds he wrote for TechCrunch about anti-trust enforcement in social media.

item.title: Google Chrome adds AI-powered store summaries to help US shoppers
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The feature will display a pop-up that informs consumers about the store's reputation for things like product quality, shopping, pricing, customer service, and returns.

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: Tesla vs GM: A tale of two earnings
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility, your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.

item.title: Tesla signs $16.5B deal with Samsung to make AI chips
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: The deal for next-generation chips is a boon for Samsung.

item.title: 20 national security experts urge Trump administration to restrict Nvidia H20 sales to China
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: The letter states that allowing sales of the H20 AI chip to China could hurt the U.S.'s AI "edge" and worsen chip bottlenecks in the U.S.

item.title: Do startups still need Silicon Valley? Hear from the founders and funders challenging old assumptions at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, Oct 27-29, will dive into whether building in Silicon Valley still gives founders an edge. Register now to save up to $625.

item.title: Meet the minds shaping AI: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 AI Stage revealed
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: The preview of the AI Stage agenda at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025. Two full days of discussions with the top AI minds. Register now to save up to $625.

item.title: Flights grounded as Russia’s largest airline Aeroflot hacked and systems ‘destroyed’
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Russian prosecutor said it opened a criminal investigation into the cyberattack targeting Aeroflot, the largest airline in Russia.

item.title: ‘The Wizard of Oz’ blown up by AI for giant Sphere screen
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: The massive Las Vegas venue known as Sphere will be screening its first classic movie, “The Wizard of Oz,” starting on August 28. And as detailed in a segment on CBS Sunday Morning, this isn’t just a matter of taking the existing movie and projecting it on Sphere’s 160,000-square-foot, wraparound LED screen.

item.title: Itch.io is the latest marketplace to crack down on adult games
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Indie video game marketplace Itch.io announced this week that it has "deindexed" adult and not-safe-for-work games, removing them from its browse and search pages.

item.title: DOGE has built an AI tool to slash federal regulations
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: The Department of Government Efficiency has presented plans to use a new AI tool to eliminate half of the federal government’s regulatory mandates by the first anniversary of President Donald Trump’s return to office, according to The Washington Post.
